title: 10 Amazing Madrid Hotels You Can Book with Points
description: Maximize your hotel points with these hotel brands in Madrid with options ranging from budget to luxury. Spend your money instead exploring art and on day trips.
author: Ramsey Qubein

The Madrid Marriott Auditorium Hotel & Conference Center is noteworthy because it is a convenient airport hotel with free shuttle service and a fantastic club lounge for Marriott Bonvoy elite members. It is also the largest Marriott hotel in Europe and a great option for short layovers. These are among the top recommendations in Madrid’s city center.1. The Palace, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Madrid(Photo courtesy of Marriott)After a major overhaul (both outside and inside), The Palace has transitioned from the Westin brand to The Luxury Collection brand. (Westin is sticking around in Madrid as the former AC Cuzco is now the Westin Madrid Cuzco.) The Palace is within walking distance of Puerta del Sol, the Royal Palace and the other museums in the Golden Triangle of Art. This is one of the city’s most famous hotels and was also the first in Europe to have all rooms equipped with private bathrooms.Marriott Bonvoy uses a dynamic pricing model for its awards, which means the cost in points varies by the date. Not only does it have fantastic dining venues, including Peruvian and Mediterranean cuisine, but its rooftop pool and terrace are a hit during the summer. During some periods of the year, rates hover around the 70,000-point mark. World of Hyatt

World of Hyatt has several of its popular brands in Madrid, and they are spread around the city. Its acquisition of Mr & Mrs Smith has given it even greater strength across the city, including many independent hotels.

These are some great options, especially since World of Hyatt continues to follow a helpful award chart so you know how many points you need to save for each stay. Even better, it is a transfer partner with Chase Ultimate Rewards®.

9. Thompson Madrid

Thompson Madrid is part of Hyatt’s upscale lifestyle brand, with properties inspired by local and popular culture. The hotel is known for its popular Spanish restaurant and basement cocktail lounge. But the best feature is its rooftop bar, lounge and pool.

Many of the hotel’s best rooms and top suites also benefit from furnished balconies overlooking the city’s rooftops. A redemption night at the World of Hyatt Category 6 hotel costs between 21,000 and 29,000 points for a standard room.

10. Hyatt Regency Hesperia Madrid

This is one of World of Hyatt’s best values in town as a Category 4 property with redemptions between 12,000 and 18,000 points.

The Hyatt Regency is a perfect home base for both business and leisure travelers because of its location along Paseo de la Castellana. Public transportation is easy to find near the hotel to reach all of the city’s top attractions.
